Description: Bivouac, one of two studies for Plate 28 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; figures around a camp fire, a tent and palm trees beyond Pen and black ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Victor Pillement. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
